snippet: In his campaign to become the darling of the cut-costs-at-all-costs Republican crowd, the governor of New Jersey killed the largest public transit project in the nation.
abstract: Editorial criticizes New Jersey Gov Chris Christie for ignoring real economic analysis and relying on exaggerated worst-case scenarios to kill the project that would have added two new rail passages under the Hudson River; charges Christie was thinking of his career and did not take into consideration what would have been best for his constituents.
lead_paragraph: In his campaign to become the darling of the cut-costs-at-all-costs Republican crowd, the governor of New Jersey killed the largest public transit project in the nation.

headline.seo: Gov. Chris Christie and the Tunnel Project
